page.title: 13 TRANSPORT IN MYDDLE
page.content: There is a small company of long distance lorries. The lorries are kept in the grounds of {Hillcrest garage, Myddle Hill. The lorries go out to{London, {Liverpool, Cardiff}and other large cities carrying animal food to the farms. These lorries mostly make one journey a day, but if the journey is short then two journeys are made. Once a week a lorry travels out to{ {Salisbury}carrying young chickens. There are nine or ten drivers and two other men who have the job of keeping the lorries in order. The lorries are very large and so they burn up alot of fuel. They are made in{Lancashire}and are {Leyland }lorries.
